column5: I have alot of fishing DVD's and dont really want to buy anymore. Just wondering if anyone would be interested in a swap. Not to keep. Just borrow , watch and then return. We could even do the book swap thing as well. I have a ton of books on every type of fishing known. Just need to find them. I would say that a 1-2 week time period would be good. Let me know what you guys think.
Love the idea, but I live in northern BC, so don't think it'd work out.

Yeah, Thats a little to far to ship.  Some DVD's that I have are - Mike Auten, Great Lakes Bass, , Kevin Vandam-Spinnerbaits, Bob Izumi,  Spro BBZ Advanced Swimbait Technique DVD, Big Bait Posse Dave Mercer Videos, Kevin Vandam-Flippin and Pitchen, Kevin Vandam-Pattern for Changing weather.  Tons of books on Walleye, Advanced bass fishing, Roland Martins book, Freshwater angling series. Pike & Muskie, Bass, Walleye, Ice Fishing, Etc.
Smalliefisher:  Thanks for the excellent idea.  I guess it'll have to be a local 'club'.  Maybe newbies like me will learn something from this media & start hooking some fish .  Os
I would assume that most people are in the GTA area anyways, still figured I would have got more responses than this.
I would be into this BUT I don't have any DVD's or book to loan out...
I have Dick Pearsons - Muskie on the Shield.  If you are musky newb, this book is a must read.  I'd like to see that Swimbait DVD to tell you the truth!
